name: Albania
description: September is a lovely month to be beside the seaside. The summer crowds have gone and taken peak prices with them, but it's still hot enough for swimming and hiking.

name: Armenia
description: Temperatures subside a little from their August heights, making for excellent weather. The main local holiday season is over. This is the last month of the walking season in many mountain areas.

name: Austria
description: The temperatures are beginning a gradual descent and crowds are tailing off. Museums and most of the activities are still in season, however, and a couple of top-class festivals are revving into action.

name: Azerbaijan
description: Temperatures subside a little from their August heights, making for excellent weather. The main local holiday season is over. This is the last month of the walking season in many mountain areas.

name: Belgium
description: The weather is often lovely, while accommodation in rural getaways is no longer overstretched.

name: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the
Croatia
description: The summer rush is over, but sunshine is still plentiful, the sea is warm and the crowds have largely gone - it's a great time to visit Croatia. Zagreb comes alive again after the summer exodus to the coast.

name: Cyprus
description: This is still a hot and hectic month. Escape the clamour of the coastal resorts by heading inland to the Troïdos Mountains for wine tasting, picnicking or gentle autumnal strolls.

name: Czech Republic
description: The hot and humid summer weather mellows out as September approaches, and the hordes of visiting backpackers, students and school groups thin out, making this a great month to visit.

name: Denmark
description: The summer madness drops off as abruptly as it began, and crowds have largely disappeared. Good weather is still a possibility, but by month's end many big outdoor attractions have wrapped things up for another year.

name: Estonia
description: The last days of summer quickly turn into the mild beginning of autumn. Rain is more frequent by the end of the month, while leaves turn brilliant colours and tumble off the trees.

name: Finland
description: The winter is fast approaching: pack something warm. Autumn colours are spectacular in northern forests, making it a great hiking month. Many attractions and activities close.

name: France
description: As sun-plump grapes hang heavy on darkened vines and that August madness drops off as abruptly as it began, a welcome tranquillity falls across autumnal France. This is the start of France's vendange (grape harvest).

name: Georgia
description: Temperatures subside a little from their August heights, making for excellent weather. The main local holiday season is over. This is the last month of the walking season in many mountain areas.

name: Germany
description: Often sunny but not too hot. The main travel season is over but September is busy thanks to lots of wine and autumn festivals. Trees may start changing colour towards the end of the month.

name: Greece
description: The sun is high though less and less blazing, especially on the islands. The crowds begin to thin and some ferry schedules begin to decline midmonth. Fresh figs and grapes are in season and plentiful.

name: Hungary
description: September brings summer to a close. It's a good time to visit as there's still a lot going on, wine is starting to flow and peak-season prices are over.

name: Iceland
description: Tourist arrivals decrease significantly and prices drop, making this a good time to visit. The weather can still be agreeable, but summer-only hotels, attractions and services are closed. Highland roads are closed by month's end.

name: Ireland
description: Summer may be over, but September weather can be surprisingly good, so it's often the ideal time to enjoy the last vestiges of sun as the crowds dwindle.

name: Italy
description: This is a glorious month to travel in Italy. Summer warmth lingers in much of the country and the start of the harvest season sees lots of local sagre (food festivals) spring up. September is also the start of the grape harvest.

name: Latvia
description: The last days of summer quickly turn into the mild beginning of autumn. Rain is more frequent by the end of the month, while leaves turn brilliant colours and tumble off the trees.

name: Lithuania
description: The last days of summer quickly turn into the mild beginning of autumn. Rain is more frequent by the end of the month, while leaves turn brilliant colours and tumble off the trees.

name: Montenegro
description: September is a lovely month to be beside the seaside. The summer crowds have gone and taken peak prices with them, but it's still hot enough for swimming and hiking.

name: Netherlands
description: Summer may be technically over but September is one of the best months to visit the Netherlands. There are some superb festivals along with fair weather and fewer crowds.

name: Norway
description: The crowds have largely disappeared, but so have most of the cheaper summer deals; in some areas, many hotels and restaurants actually close down. In short, it's a quieter but often more expensive time to visit.

name: Poland
description: The first nip of autumn arrives early in the month as kids return to school and life returns to normal. There's usually a long patch of sunshine in September, perfect to enjoy the crowd-free resorts.

name: Portugal
description: Peak tourist season officially runs until mid-September, when warm weather ensures beaches remain packed. Things cool down and prices dip as crowds dissipate by late September.

name: Romania
description: A great month to visit. The days are warm and sunny, with plenty of daylight. The start of mushrooming season pushes city dwellers into the woods in search of the perfect fungus.

name: Slovenia
description: Autumn chill comes to the mountains. Swimming winds down on the Adriatic coast and resorts like Bled and Bohini hold their last big shindigs. Mushroom-hunting shifts into high gear.

name: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
Spain
description: This is the month when Spain returns to work after a seemingly endless summer. Numerous festivals take advantage of the fact that weather generally remains warm until late September at least.

name: Sweden
description: Days begin to grow shorter and cooler, and many seasonal tourist facilities (campgrounds, some hostels, outdoor cafes) close for the season, but the weather can still be gorgeous.

name: Switzerland
description: Golden autumn days and grape harvests make this a great month for backcountry rambles. In the Alps, the cows come home in spectacular style.

name: Turkey
description: Istanbul's second high season begins; elsewhere, it's shoulder season - temperatures, crowds and prices lessen. Accommodation and activities, such as boat trips, begin winding down for the winter.

name: Ukraine
description: Temperatures mellow out, people return to the cities and everyday life resumes in the hazy light of Ukrainian autumn. By far the best time to travel and to gorge on Ukraine's legendary fruit and veg.

name: United Kingdom
description: The first week of September is still holiday time, but then schools reopen, traffic returns to normal, and the summer party's over for another year. Ironically, the weather's often better than in August, now everyone's back at work.
